marketNews.title: IHSG fell -0.28%, BBNI 9M24: Net Profit Rp16.3 T (+3.5% YoY). News compilation for today.
marketNews.content: IHSG fell -0.28%, BBNI 9M24: Net Profit Rp16.3 T (+3.5% YoY). News compilation for today. October 25, 2024

marketNews.title: AKRA: Low Performance Recovery in 3Q24, Below Expectations
marketNews.content: AKR Corporindo [recorded](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202410/20241025140541-48093-0/akr%20corporindo_tbk_bilingual_30%20Sep%202024_release.pdf) a significant decline in net profit to 466 billion rupiah (-31% YoY, +14% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to only 1.5 trillion rupiah (-14% YoY), below expectations as it only accounted for 52% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The low net profit in 3Q24 was caused by a decrease in revenue and weak margins. - Low Recovery in Trading and Distribution Segment Profit before tax (PBT) for the Trading and Distribution segment - which contributes about 65-75% of AKRA's total PBT - decreased by -20% YoY during 9M24. This result was pressured by a -5% YoY decrease in Fuel Oil (BBM) sales volume due to issues with the RKAB permit in 1H24 and high rainfall at customer mine sites in 3Q24. Weak sales to the mining sector ultimately caused a significant drop in the margins of AKRA's Trading and Distribution segment. This is because sales to the mining sector have higher margins compared to customers from other sectors such as manufacturing and transportation. - JIIPE Land Sales of 70 ha in 4Q24, Target Downgraded Again AKRA Management revised down the guidance for JIIPE land sales for 2024 from 115 ha to 100 ha. This guidance revision was made after JIIPE land sales only reached 32 ha as of 9M24, equivalent to 32% of the new target and 28% of the old target. Previously, AKRA in 2Q24 had revised the guidance for JIIPE land sales from 130 ha to 115 ha. Although JIIPE land sales increased by +8% YoY to 32 ha during 9M24, PBT from the Industrial Estate segment dropped by -15% YoY. AKRA Management explained that the decrease in PBT from the Industrial Estate segment was due to a fair value adjustment in trade receivables because of longer payment terms from clients. - No Additional Interim Dividend AKRA Management confirmed that there will be no 2nd interim dividend distribution for the 2024 fiscal year. Previously, AKRA distributed an interim dividend of 50 rupiah per share in August 2024. For the 2023 fiscal year, AKRA distributed interim dividends 2 times, namely 50 rupiah per share in August 2023 and 25 rupiah per share in November 2023. Key Takeaway With these weak results, AKRA Management revised down the net profit guidance for 2024 from a range of +4-7% YoY to -14% YoY, or around the 2022 net profit level of 2.4 trillion rupiah. We assess that the consensus will again cut AKRA's performance estimates. In the last 3 months, the consensus has cut AKRA's net profit estimate for FY24F by -8% to 2.8 trillion rupiah. We predict this decline in net profit will impact the 2024 fiscal year dividend payout ratio, which will not be as high as in 2023 at 90%, considering AKRA still needs capex for the construction of a tank terminal in Morowali and the development of the JIIPE industrial area.

marketNews.title: BBNI 9M24: Net Profit Rp16.3 T (+3.5% YoY)
marketNews.content: BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia [recorded](https://www.bni.co.id/Portals/1/BNI/Perusahaan/HubunganInvestor/Docs/2024/BNI-Financial-Statement-3Q2024-EN.pdf) a net profit of 5.6 trillion rupiah (+5% QoQ, +3% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 16.3 trillion rupiah (+3.5% YoY), equivalent to 74% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The result was supported by a decrease in provision expenses to 1.8 trillion rupiah (+8% QoQ, -19% YoY) in 3Q24, so that provision expenses for 9M24 decreased to 5.2 trillion rupiah (-23% YoY). In terms of top line, Net Interest Income (NII) in 3Q24 increased to 10.4 trillion rupiah (+7% QoQ, -2% YoY), so that NII during 9M24 decreased by -5.5% YoY to 29.4 trillion rupiah. BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales of approximately 2 trillion rupiah (+2.1% YoY, -23.8% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought marketing sales during 9M24 to approximately 6.8 trillion rupiah (+1.4% YoY), equivalent to 72% of the 2024 target of 9.5 trillion rupiah. The housing segment contributed 56% of total marketing sales during 9M24, followed by shophouses (23%), apartments (7%), commercial land (6%), and land plot sales to joint ventures (8%). ASRI: Alam Sutera Realty [recorded](https://investasi.kontan.co.id/news/alam-sutera-realty-asri-catat-marketing-sales-rp-23-triliun-per-september-2024) marketing sales of 1.1 trillion rupiah (+95% YoY, +76% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result led marketing sales during 9M24 to reach 2.3 trillion rupiah (+48% YoY), equivalent to 82% of the 2024 target of 2.8 trillion rupiah and has surpassed the 2023 marketing sales realization of 1.8 trillion rupiah. Corporate Secretary of ASRI, Tony Rudiyanto, said that the marketing sales realization was contributed by The Gramercy product in Alam Sutera, Sutera YMMA (Alam Sutera 2), Agra Cluster in Suvarna Sutera, and several commercial products. BNLI: Bank Permata [recorded](https://www.permatabank.com/sites/default/files/documents/pdf/Laporan%20Publikasi_Sept%202024.pdf) a net profit of 1.3 trillion rupiah (+74% QoQ, +71% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in a net profit for 9M24 reaching 2.8 trillion rupiah (+30% YoY). This result was supported by a significant drop in provision expenses to 147 billion rupiah (-75% QoQ, -77% YoY) in 3Q24, so that provision expenses for 9M24 decreased to 1.2 trillion rupiah (-36% YoY). In terms of top line, Net Interest Income (NII) in 3Q24 increased to 2.6 trillion rupiah (+4.4% QoQ, 3.9% YoY), so that NII during 9M24 grew +2.2% YoY to 7.6 trillion rupiah. BTPS: Bank BTPN Syariah [recorded](https://btpnsyariah.com/documents/20182/95402/Q3.id/4d3d252a-7766-40e8-be3b-7b6221ae09f5?version=1.0) a net profit of 218.4 billion rupiah (-24% QoQ, -13% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 770.6 billion rupiah (-23% YoY), equivalent to 69% of the consensus FY24F estimate. This result was pressured by a decrease in revenue after profit sharing distribution to 1.2 trillion rupiah (-2.5% QoQ, -11% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in revenue after profit sharing distribution during 9M24 being 3.7 trillion rupiah (-6.6% YoY). Weakness in the top line caused operating profit to also fall to 277.7 billion rupiah (-24% QoQ, -14% YoY) in 3Q24, so that operational profit for 9M24 reached 979.4 billion rupiah (-24% YoY). HEAL: Medikaloka Hermina [recorded](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202410/20241025090723-48168-0/HEAL_Billingual_30%20September%202024.pdf) a net profit of 125 billion rupiah (-14% YoY, -18% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 468 billion rupiah (+34% YoY), equivalent to 75% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The decline in net profit in 3Q24 was mainly due to expenses growing higher - both COGS (+14% YoY) and opex (+10% YoY) - compared to revenue growth (+9% YoY), causing the operating profit margin in 3Q24 to drop to 14.9% (vs. 3Q23: 17.6%, 2Q24: 17.3%). DRMA: Dharma Polimetal [recorded](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202410/20241025161341-48357-0/DRMA%200924.pdf) a net profit of 175 billion rupiah (+1% YoY, +69% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 412 billion rupiah (-21% YoY). 3Q24 performance was relatively better compared to the previous 2 quarters, with net profit still managing to grow +1% YoY compared to declines in 1Q24 (-38% YoY) and 2Q24 (-20% YoY). The better performance was mainly due to the increased performance of the motorcycle segment which has the highest margin compared to other segments, thus lifting the overall margin. Revenue from the motorcycle segment grew +19% YoY in 3Q24 (vs. 1Q24: +2% YoY, 2Q24: +4% YoY). SMDM: Suryamas Dutamakmur [announced](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202410/d5f9fa35e9_4512deffa4.pdf) that Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE), had acquired 4.4 billion (92%) shares of SMDM at a price of 531 rupiah per share on October 23, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.3 trillion rupiah. Following the completion of this transaction, BSDE will become the new controller of SMDM and will conduct a mandatory tender offer. Previously, BSDE in August 2024 [announced](https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/bsde-berencana-akuisisi-smdm-rp24-t) that the company was negotiating with Top Global Ltd. - an entity still affiliated with the Sinar Mas family - to acquire approximately 92% of SMDM shares. BRMS: President Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Agoes Projosasmito, stated that there is no effort from management to move the company's shares into the MSCI index constituents. However, Agoes explained that BRMS, through its subsidiary, PT Citra Palu Minerals (CPM), is indeed expanding. [Bloomberg Technoz](https://www.bloombergtechnoz.com/detail-news/52804/respons-agoes-projosasmito-soal-isu-brms-digiring-masuk-msci/2) reported that Agoes' statement emerged after market rumors suggested BRMS shares could enter the MSCI index if their share price reached the level of 400 rupiah per share. SIDO: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul will [distribute](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202410/8d296453ce_7fec3c0aa6.pdf) an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 540 billion rupiah or 18 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is November 4, 2024, while payment is on November 20, 2024. Referring to SIDO's share price at the close of trading on Friday (10/25) at 615 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.9%.

marketNews.title: Gaikindo Revises Down National Car Sales Target for 2024 to 850,000 Units
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the First Association of Indonesian Automotive Industries (Gaikindo), Jongkie Sugiarto, [said](https://industri.kontan.co.id/news/gaikindo-pangkas-target-penjualan-mobil-nasional-tahun-2024-menjadi-850000-unit) that they revised down the national car wholesale sales target for 2024 from 1.1 million units to 850,000 units. The new target is -15.5% lower than the 2023 wholesale sales realization of 1 million units. This revision is based on the realization of national car wholesale sales which decreased by -16.2% YoY during 9M24 to 633,218 units. Referring to the new target, the realization during 9M24 has reached 74.5% of the target.

marketNews.title: XL Axiata and Smartfren Merger Targeted to Complete by Year End
marketNews.content: The President Director of XL Axiata (EXCL), Dian Siswarini, [said](https://market.bisnis.com/read/20241024/192/1810284/merger-xl-axiata-excl-dan-smartfren-fren-ditargetkan-selesai-akhir-tahun) that they are optimistic that the merger plan with Smartfren Telecom (FREN) will soon receive government approval, so that the merger can be implemented by the end of this year. Previously, EXCL and FREN signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding to explore the merger plan in May 2024.

marketNews.title: Adhi Karya Records New Contract Value of Rp14.2 Trillion (-43% YoY) During 9M24
marketNews.content: Adhi Karya (ADHI) [recorded](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202410/7029afaeb0_35436b38b2.pdf) a new contract value of 14.2 trillion rupiah (-43% YoY) during 9M24, equivalent to 38% of the 2024 target of 37.4 trillion rupiah. Based on its funding sources, the government contributed 54%, followed by SOEs/BUMDs (19%), private sector (18%), and loans (9%). Based on business lines, contract acquisition was dominated by 90% from the engineering and construction segment, followed by property and hospitality (4%), manufacturing (4%), and investment and concession (2%).

marketNews.title: Ceramic Entrepreneurs Predict New Investment of Rp20 Trillion from 3 Million Houses Program
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association, Edy Suyanto, [said](https://katadata.co.id/berita/industri/671b42d877f22/program-3-juta-rumah-pengusaha-keramik-prediksi-akan-ada-investasi-baru-rp-20-t) that the program to build 3 million houses per year, as envisioned by President Prabowo Subianto's administration, has the potential to add new ceramic demand of around 100 million square meters per year. This amount is equivalent to 16% of the current total industry production capacity of 625 million square meters. Edy mentioned that they are optimistic the program will boost national ceramic industry utilization from the level of 64% as of October 2024 to 85% in 2024 and 95% in 2026. In line with the projection of near-full utilization in 2026, Edy stated that the ceramic industry must add installed capacity of 75 million square meters or around 20 trillion rupiah in 2027. This estimated investment value has the potential to absorb 10,000 new workers, said Edy.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Wants to Join BRICS, Says Foreign Minister
marketNews.content: The Minister of Foreign Affairs, Sugiono, [said](https://www.reuters.com/world/indonesia-wants-join-brics-ministry-says-2024-10-25/) that Indonesia wants to join the BRICS group. Sugiono [mentioned](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-10-25/indonesia-joins-growing-list-of-nations-keen-to-be-part-of-brics) that BRICS - led by Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa - is the "right vehicle" to advance the interests of developing countries and Indonesia's joining the group is a realization of a free and active foreign policy. Sugiono's statement came after Indonesia officially became a partner country (not a full member) in BRICS on [Thursday](https://epaper.kontan.co.id/mobile/harian/2024/10/25) (10/24). Previously, President Prabowo Subianto stated that Indonesia will continue to engage with other multilateral groups. In the near future, President Prabowo will attend the G20 Summit in Brazil in November 2024 and Indonesia is also undergoing the accession process to join the OECD as a member.

marketNews.title: BRICS Members Agree to Use Local Currencies in Financial Transactions
marketNews.content: BRICS group member countries agreed to use local currencies in financial transactions between members and their trading partners, based on the [announcement](https://epaper.bisnis.com/epaper/detail/page/146027/) of the 16th BRICS Summit on October 22-24, 2024. Previously, Russian President Vladimir Putin, on Tuesday (10/22) called for an alternative international payment system to prevent the US from using the US dollar as a 'political weapon'.

marketNews.title: BPK Finds Invalid Data Calculation by Bapanas Led to Soaring Food Commodity Prices in 1H24
marketNews.content: The Audit Board of Indonesia (BPK) found that the calculation of production and needs for strategic food commodities conducted by the National Food Agency (Bapanas) did not use valid and up-to-date data, causing the prices of several food commodities to skyrocket in 1H24. Consequently, BPK [stated](https://ekonomi.bisnis.com/read/20241024/9/1810403/bpk-ungkap-biang-kerok-harga-komoditas-pangan-meroket) that the food balance projections from Bapanas and the commodity balance for rice, corn, soybeans, onions, chili, sugar, beef, poultry meat, and poultry eggs in the National Commodity Balance System cannot be used as a measure in decision-making and policy formulation for stabilizing national food supply and prices, including import policies.

marketNews.title: Pan Brothers Circulates Restructuring Plan to Creditors
marketNews.content: [Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-10-25/defaulted-clothes-maker-pan-brothers-circulates-restructure-plan) reported that the garment issuer, Pan Brothers (PBRX), is circulating a restructuring plan to its creditors for the first time since defaulting on its debt in early 2024. Bloomberg sources stated that PBRX plans to reduce its debt burden from around US$325 million to US$140 million, a level considered sustainable over the next 15 years. PBRX is also reported to plan to convert US dollar-denominated bonds and half of its bilateral loans into mandatory convertible bonds (MCB) that will not bear interest. The MCBs can be converted into equity after 10 years, with creditors controlling 51% of PBRX shares after conversion. For the syndicated loan of US$123 million, PBRX is rumored to propose an extension of the maturity date up to 15 years with an interest rate of only 1% for the first 5-6 years. Bloomberg mentioned that this plan may change after negotiations with creditors, while PBRX management has not yet commented.

marketNews.title: BEI: Sri Rejeki Isman Meets Delisting Criteria After Declared Bankrupt
marketNews.content: BEI Director, I Gede Nyoman Yetna, [said](https://www.bloombergtechnoz.com/detail-news/52946/resmi-dinyatakan-pailit-bei-bicara-potensi-delisting-sritex/2) that Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) has met the criteria for delisting after the textile company was declared bankrupt by the Semarang District Court. Trading of SRIL shares has also been suspended for 42 months, thus subject to forced delisting. Nyoman also mentioned that the BEI has asked SRIL to provide a public explanation regarding the company's steps after being declared bankrupt.

marketNews.title: Jobubu Jarum Minahasa Launches New Grape Wine Product 'Anggur Nikmat Indonesia'
marketNews.content: Jobubu Jarum Minahasa (BEER) [announced](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202410/9732adaec5_2ffd86976d.pdf) the launch of a new product named Anggur Nikmat Indonesia. This grape wine product has an alcohol content of 19.9%, placing it in category B alcoholic beverages. BEER Management hopes that this grape wine product can boost the company's revenue, considering the total grape alcoholic beverage market is about 40 times larger than the soju market. Before releasing this grape wine product, BEER was better known as the producer of Cap Tikus 1978, Daebak Soju, and Daebak Spark.
